title: Fully polynomial-time approximation scheme
summary: A fully polynomial-time approximation scheme (FPTAS) is an algorithm for finding approximate solutions to function problems, especially optimization problems.  An FPTAS takes as input an instance of the problem and a parameter ε > 0. It returns as output a value is at least 1 − ϵ {\displaystyle 1-\epsilon } times the correct value, and at most 1 + ϵ {\displaystyle 1+\epsilon } times the correct value.
